title: Woman takes dishwasher job at nursing home to visit husband amid pandemic
description: After not being able to see her husband Steve for 114 days, Mary Daniel has taken a job as a dishwasher at the nursing home he’s staying at to spend more time with him.

title: Actress Kelly Preston dies of breast cancer at 57
description: Kelly Preston starred in many cherished films including “Jerry Maguire” and “Twins.” Preston and her husband, John Travolta, had three children together.

title: Body of ‘Glee’ actress Naya Rivera found at Lake Piru in California
description: Rivera had been boating with her 4-year-old son at Lake Piru last week when she went missing. A body recovered from the lake on Monday was identified as Rivera by authorities.

author: NBCNews.com
title: ‘You are misleading the public!’: Florida governor heckled during coronavirus briefing
description: Florida Gov. DeSantis was interrupted during his coronavirus briefing when a heckler started yelling at him, “You are misleading the public!” claiming the governor was blaming protesters for the massive rise in COVID-19 cases in the state.

description: Some students in New York and Florida may not return to school either as cases continue to surge. The Trump administration is not issuing any guidelines to reopen, distancing themselves from those proposed by the CDC and the American Academy of Pediatrics.

title: Trump defends relationship with Fauci despite White House efforts to discredit him
description: President Trump said on Monday that he has a “very good relationship” with Dr. Fauci. His comments come a day after a White House official sent reporters a memo listing what it claimed were inaccurate statements made by Fauci.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Growing concern over coronavirus testing troubles across the U.S.
description: In states like Florida, California, Texas and Arizona, testing troubles are increasingly bogging down the nation’s coronavirus response. Public health officials say skyrocketing demand is creating a shortage of testing supplies.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Hospitals overwhelmed as coronavirus cases rise
description: Across the country hospitals are finding themselves under equipped to handle the growing coronavirus cases, often having more patients than they can hold while health care workers put their own lives on the line.
source.name: NBC News

title: California rolls back reopening as coronavirus cases surge
description: Following reopenings, states across the country have seen massive increases in coronavirus cases as health officials urge Americans to maintain safety measures to decrease the immense spread.
